definition:
A sector is a fraction of the interior of a circle, described by a
central angle $\theta$. If $\theta = 2 \pi,$ the sector becomes a
complete circle.

![image](sector.eps)

If the central angle is $\theta,$ and the radius of the circle is $r,$
then the area of the sector is given by $$\frac{1}{2}r^2\theta$$

This is obvious from the fact that the area of a sector is
$\frac{\theta}{2 \pi}$ times the area of the circle (which is
$\pi r^2$). Note that, in the formula, $\theta$ is in radians.

**Remark**. Since the length $a$ of the arc of the sector is $r\theta$,
the area of the sector is $\frac{1}{2}ar$, which is equal to the area of
a triangle with base $=a$ and the height $=r$.
